case_vignette: A 71-year-old man comes to the physician accompanied by his wife because of a 6-month history of worsening episodic upper abdominal pain and an 8-kg (17.6-lb) weight loss. He has smoked a pack of cigarettes daily for 20 years and drinks 1–2 beers daily. His pulse is 79/min and blood pressure is 138/89 mm Hg.
